meanings.definition: The earliest produce or income of a season, given as an offering to God.
meanings.sent1: The farmer brought the firstfruits of his harvest to the temple.
meanings.sent2: We offered the firstfruits of our labor to show gratitude.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the acorn was the firstfruits of the tree's generosity.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the firstfruits of happiness blooming in spring.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh bread was the firstfruits of the bakery's morning bake.

meanings.definition: The first results or benefits of an endeavor.
meanings.sent1: Receiving praise for his hard work was the firstfruits of his efforts.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated the firstfruits of their successful project.
meanings.sent3: Finding a dollar on the street felt like the firstfruits of luck.
meanings.sent4: Her promotion was the firstfruits of her dedication to the job.
meanings.sent5: The first customer of the day was the firstfruits of a busy shift ahead.

meanings.definition: The first installment or portion of something.
meanings.sent1: He paid the firstfruits of the loan, signaling his commitment.
meanings.sent2: The down payment was the firstfruits of owning their dream home.
meanings.sent3: The first slice of cake was the firstfruits of the birthday celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her initial investment was the firstfruits of her business venture.
meanings.sent5: The opening scene of the movie was the firstfruits of the thrilling plot.
